intro: Heracleum dulce, commonly known as sweet cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the family. Heracleum dulce is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. It is noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
